metadata.Title: CVE-2015-1805 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
The (1) pipe_read and (2) pipe_write implementations in fs/pipe.c in theLinux kernel before 3.16 do not properly consider the side effects offailed __copy_to_user_inatomic and __copy_from_user_inatomic calls, whichallows local users to cause a denial of service (system crash) or possiblygain privileges via a crafted application, aka an "I/O vector arrayoverrun."

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-1805` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.2.0-16.19
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.2.0-16.19
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-lowlatency - 4.2.0-16.19
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.2.0-1013-raspi2 - 4.2.0-1013.19
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1012-snapdragon - 4.4.0-1012.12
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1129-aws - 4.4.0-1001.10
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

No subscription required
